intro: Hydrolea spinosa var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
